purpose_text.para: Holds event counter n, which counts events, where n is 0 to 30.

field_description.para: Event counter n. Value of event counter n, where n is the number of this register and is a number from 0 to 30.
Event counter n. Value of event counter n, where n is the number of this register and is a number from 0 to 30.

access_permission_text.para: PMEVCNTR<n>_EL0 can also be accessed by using PMXEVCNTR_EL0 with PMSELR_EL0.SEL set to the value of <n>.
If is implemented and <n> is greater than or equal to the number of accessible counters, then the behavior of permitted reads and writes of PMEVCNTR<n>_EL0 is as follows:

listitem.content: If <n> is an unimplemented event counter, the access is UNDEFINED.
Otherwise, the access is trapped to EL2.

access_permission_text.para: If is not implemented and <n> is greater than or equal to the number of accessible counters, then reads and writes of PMEVCNTR<n>_EL0 are CONSTRAINED UNPREDICTABLE, and the following behaviors are permitted:

listitem.content: Accesses to the register are UNDEFINED.
Accesses to the register behave as RAZ/WI.
Accesses to the register execute as a NOP.
If EL2 is implemented and enabled in the current Security state, and <n> is less than the number of implemented event counters, accesses from EL1 or permitted accesses from EL0 are trapped to EL2.

note.para: In EL0, an access is permitted if it is enabled by PMUSERENR_EL0.{ER,EN}.

If EL2 is implemented and enabled in the current Security state, in EL1 and EL0, MDCR_EL2.HPMN identifies the number of accessible event counters. Otherwise, the number of accessible event counters is the number of implemented event counters. See MDCR_EL2.HPMN for more details.
